job description:
Recognized as an external and internal expert and thought leader with deep and substantive technical expertise as well as advanced business knowledge and leadership capabilities.
Communicates with contacts inside and outside of the organization on matters of strategic importance to influence executive leadership on new concepts, practices, and approaches.
Establishes overall direction for new processes, systems, and solutions.
Recommends and implements strategies and develops operational plans/goals with direct impact to the achievement against functional strategies.
Responsible for establishing the direction for new processes, systems, solutions, and products using significant conceptualization, reason, and interpretation. Solutions are innovative and often define best practice for the future.
Opportunities for problem solving and innovation are regularly complex, requiring broad-based consideration of variables that impact multiple areas of the organization.
Extensively analyzes implications of both near and long-term implications of solutions.
Investigates, analyzes and provides solutions to complex problems encountered by engineering services and quality control using standard engineering practices.
Authors technical documents and presentations.
Qualifications:

Bachelor’s Degree with a minimum of 15 years of prior related experience or a Graduate Degree with a minimum of 13 years of prior related experience.
An Active TS/SCI Clearance

Preferred Additional Skills:

PhD in Optics, Physics, Imaging Science or Engineering equivalent.
Advanced knowledge of passive remote sensing systems
Advanced knowledge of ground processing architectures and image processing algorithms for passive remote sensing systems
A thorough understanding of image processing techniques and software tools.
A proven ability to shape technical strategies and roadmaps simultaneously advancing corporate capabilities and achieving annual business metrics.
A proven ability to incorporate cutting edge technologies to develop new/novel methods of distilling remote sensing data down into actionable intelligence.
20 years of experience working with customer remotely sensed data
Experience with ENVI/IDL programming, MATLAB, Python, UNIX based scripting, and/or C++ programming.
Experience working on proposals as Technical Author or Capture Manager.
Experience as a Technical Lead and/or Chief Architect developing technical solutions for EXP customer, defining processing architecture, and leading development of high-end ground processing algorithms.
Experience in corporate strategic planning, providing technical oversight of IRAD while incorporating novel methods to solve customer problems in alignment with business/strategic objectives.
Experience working on proposals as Technical Author or Capture Manager for Harris EXP customer.
Experience with Advanced Geospatial Intelligence (AGI) and FSG (Full Spectrum GEOINT).
Experience with analysis, exploitation, advanced processing of Visible and IR electro-optical (EO) systems.
